metadata.description: The metadata description of the Workload.

name.description: A string that can describe the Workload. This must be a valid RFC1123 Label Name of up to 63 characters, including a-z, 0-9, '-' but may not start or end with '-'.

annotations.description: Annotations that apply to the Workload. The annotation can contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and '-' and may contain an optional /-separated RFC1123 Host Name prefix.

service.description: The service that the workload provides.

ports.description: The set of named network ports published by the service. The service name must be a valid RFC1123 Label Name of up to 63 characters, including a-z, 0-9, '-' but may not start or end with '-'.

containers.description: The set of named containers in the Workload. The container name must be a valid RFC1123 Label Name of up to 63 characters, including a-z, 0-9, '-' but may not start or end with '-'.

resources.description: The Resource dependencies needed by the Workload. The resource name must be a valid RFC1123 Label Name of up to 63 characters, including a-z, 0-9, '-' but may not start or end with '-'.

protocol.description: The transport level protocol. Defaults to TCP.

targetPort.description: The internal service port. This will default to 'port' if not provided.

resource.description: The set of Resources associated with this Workload.

type.description: The Resource type. This should be a type supported by the Score implementations being used.

class.description: An optional specialisation of the Resource type.

id.description: An optional external Resource identifier. When two resources share the same type, class, and id, they are considered the same resource when used across related Workloads. The id must be a valid RFC1123 Label Name of up to 63 characters, including a-z, 0-9, '-' but may not start or end with '-'.

annotations.description: Annotations that apply to the Resource. The annotation can contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and '-' and may contain an optional /-separated RFC1123 Host Name prefix.

params.description: Optional parameters used to provision the Resource in the environment.

resourcesLimits.description: The compute and memory resource limits.

memory.description: The memory limit in bytes with optional unit specifier. For example 125M or 1Gi.

cpu.description: The CPU limit as whole or fractional CPUs. 'm' indicates milli-CPUs. For example 2 or 125m.

container.description: The specification of a Container within the Workload.

image.description: The container image name and tag.

command.description: If specified, overrides the entrypoint defined in the container image.

args.description: If specified, overrides the arguments passed to the container entrypoint.

variables.description: The environment variables for the container.

files.description: The extra files to mount into the container.

target.description: The file path to expose in the container.

mode.description: The optional file access mode in octal encoding. For example 0600.

source.description: The relative or absolute path to the content file.

content.description: The inline content for the file.

noExpand.description: If set to true, the placeholders expansion will not occur in the contents of the file.

path.description: An optional sub path in the volume.

target.description: The target mount on the container.

readOnly.description: Indicates if the volume should be mounted in a read-only mode.

resources.description: The compute resources for the container.

limits.description: The maximum allowed resources for the container.

requests.description: The minimal resources required for the container.

livenessProbe.description: The liveness probe for the container.

readinessProbe.description: The readiness probe for the container.

host.description: Host name to connect to. Defaults to the workload IP. The is equivalent to a Host HTTP header.

scheme.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host (HTTP or HTTPS). Defaults to HTTP.

path.description: The path to access on the HTTP server.

port.description: The port to access on the workload.

httpHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to send with the request
